Garuda: Sriwijaya Tidak Lagi Jadi Anggota Grup Kami
07 Nov 2019, 05:41 by Achmad Dwi Afriyadi


Foto: Ari Saputra

Jakarta - Hubungan maskapai Badan Usaha Milik Negara (BUMN) PT Garuda Indonesia (Persero) dan PT Sriwijaya Air kembali retak. Hal itu terkuak melalui pesan berantai Direktur Pemeliharaan & Layanan Garuda Indonesia, Iwan Joeniarto.Pesan itu mengacu hubungan kerja sama manajemen antara Sriwijaya Air dan PT Citilink Indonesia yakni anak usaha Garuda Indonesia. Dijelaskan, karena keadaan dan beberapa hal yang belum diselesaikan oleh kedua pihak maka Sriwijaya Air melanjutkan bisnis sendiri."Dengan demikian, Sriwijaya tidak akan lagi menjadi anggota Garuda Indonesia Group," bunyi pesan itu seperti dikutip detikcom, Kamis (7/11/2019).Hubungan antara Garuda Indonesia Group dan Sriwijaya Group akan dilanjutkan pada basis bisnis ke bisnis.Saat dikonfirmasi, Iwan belum memberi keterangan jelas jika pesan itu berasal dari dirinya. Dia hanya bilang VP Corporate Secretary Garuda Indonesia Ikhsan Rosan akan memberi penjelasan."Nanti akan dijelaskan oleh Pak Ikhsan ya. Saya sedang rapat dan jadwal penuh," ujarnya kepada detikcom.Sementara, mengutip CNBC Indonesia, Direktur Teknik Romdani Ardali Adang Sriwijaya tak menampik informasi tersebut. Hanya, tak dijelaskan lebih lanjut alasan pemutusan kerja sama tersebut. "Benar [pesan yang disampaikan Iwan Joeniarto]," kata Romdani kepada CNBC Indonesia.Berikut isi pesan lengkap dari pihak Garuda Indonesia terkait kerja sama dengan Sriwijaya:Dear Sir/Madam,We refer to current status of management cooperation between PT Sriwijaya Air ("Sriwijaya") and PT Citilink Indonesia ("Citilink") a member of Garuda Indonesia ("Garuda") Group. Due to the circumstances and some matter which both parties have not yet settled, We regret to inform you that Sriwijaya is resuming business on their own.As such, Sriwijaya will no longer be a member of Garuda Indonesia Group.The relationship between Garuda Indonesia Group and Sriwijaya Group will be resume on a business-to-business basis.Should you have any further inquiries, please donnot hesitate to contact us.Sincerely,Iwan JoeniartoPT Garuda Indonesia (Persero) TbkDirector of Maintenance & ServicesSimak Video "Garuda Indonesia Larang Penumpang Bawa MacBook Pro 15 Inci"[Gambas:Video 20detik](fdl/fdl)

Garuda: Sriwijaya is no longer a member of our group
07 Nov 2019, 05:41 by Achmad Dwi Afriyadi


Photo: Ari Saputra

Jakarta - The relationship of the state-owned enterprise (BUMN) airline PT Garuda Indonesia (Persero) and PT Sriwijaya Air has cracked again. This was revealed through a chain message from Garuda Indonesia Maintenance & Service Director Iwan Joeniarto. The message referred to the management cooperation relationship between Sriwijaya Air and PT Citilink Indonesia, a subsidiary of Garuda Indonesia. Explained, because of the situation and several things that had not been resolved by both parties, Sriwijaya Air continued its own business. "Thus, Sriwijaya will no longer be a member of the Garuda Indonesia Group," the message said as quoted by AFP on Thursday (11/07/2019) The relationship between Garuda Indonesia Group and Sriwijaya Group will be continued on a business-to-business basis. When confirmed, Iwan had not given a clear statement if the message originated from him. He only said VP of Garuda Indonesia Corporate Secretary Ikhsan Rosan would give an explanation. "Later it will be explained by Mr. Ikhsan yes. I am in a meeting and full schedule," he told detikcom. the. Only, there was no further explanation for the reason for terminating the cooperation. "Right [the message delivered by Iwan Joeniarto]," Romdani told CNBC Indonesia. Following the complete message from Garuda Indonesia regarding cooperation with Sriwijaya: Dear Sir / Madam, We refer to the current status of management cooperation between PT Sriwijaya Air (" Sriwijaya ") and PT Citilink Indonesia (" Citilink ") a member of the Garuda Indonesia (" Garuda ") Group. Due to the circumstances and some matters which both parties have not yet settled, We regret to inform you that Sriwijaya is resuming business on their own. As such, Sriwijaya will no longer be a member of the Garuda Indonesia Group. The relationship between the Garuda Indonesia Group and Sriwijaya Group will be a resume on a business-to-business basis.
